unnormalised: Urban planning in India, post-independence (15/08/1947), faces challenges. The Nehruvian model, while visionary, needs recalibration. Consider the Dharavi redevelopment project, stalled since 2004. We need data-driven approaches, not just top-down diktats. The 74th Amendment Act of 1992 aimed to empower local bodies; are we seeing real devolution? Experts at IIT-Bombay should offer solutions by 17:00 hrs, 26/01/2024. Effective urban policy demands collaboration between planners, citizens, and the government.
